Description: Pre-made variety. (Store-bought)
Pre-made variety. (Store-bought)
Pre-made variety. (Store-bought) (Fox Nuts)
Pre-made variety. (Store-bought)
Granola bars, protein bars, or any other alternative (Store-bought)

Any Fruit - Bite & Dip in Fruit Salt
(Fruit Salt - (Salt + Sugar + Red Chilli or Chaat Masala))
Notes: Fruit, Thai fruit salt (salt+sugar+red chilli) or chaat masala

Description:
Cut up any fruit. 
Add Thai fruit salt or chaat masala. 
Add one veg if adventurous.
Notes: Assorted fruits, Thai fruit salt / chaat masala, optional veg

Description:
Microwave popcorn bags 
Store-Bought. 
Follow Instructions for microwave

Popcorn Kernels and Oil/butter.
Add on sauce pan or anything that can be covered.
Wait for popping, move it slowly for stirring without opening the cover.
Keep gas to medium, turn off when popping has a 2-3 second gap.

Scramble them. 
Add cheese or seasoning for variety. 
If too hard/leathery, add salsa, ketchup, mayo, dressing. 
Mushrooms can be crumbled & cooked for toppings. 
Pre-cut frozen veggies can be added.
Notes: Eggs, optional: cheese, seasoning, salsa, ketchup, mayo, dressing, mushrooms, pre-cut frozen veggies

Description:
Crack eggs into a microwaveable container. 
Optionally add milk, butter, salt.
Beat and mix. 
Cook in microwave, checking every minute until still a bit gooey. 
Mix.
Boil a few extra and store in the fridge.
To warm up, microwave some water and pour over cold eggs, keep aside for 1 minute.

Food Type: Boiled Eggs - Cooking Timings (from room temp water)
Description:
10 minutes for soft boiled (harder to peel), 
13 minutes for hard boiled.

Food Type: Boiled Eggs - Cooking Timings (from boiling water)
Description:
7 minutes for soft boiled (harder to peel), 
10 minutes for hard boiled.

Lowest energy: Break in half and scoop out. 
Or, put in cold/room temp water after boiling, crack shell all over, leave for 5 mins.

Can add to eggs. 
Steam in microwave (top with salt, butter). 
Airfry or put in an oven to crisp. 
Fry in a pan if you can.
Notes: Pre-cut frozen veggies, optional: salt, butter

Description:
Butter in pan, set to low heat. 
Add two slices of bread. 
Put a slice of cheese between them when toasted.

Use pre-packaged soup packets. 
Add to appropriate boiling water.
Keep mixing to avoid clumps.
* Eat with cheese sandwich. 
* Cut up cheese sandwich for croutons.
Order the curry and make rice at home.
Order roti and make sabzi (vegetable dish) at home.
Order protein/meat and make a salad.
If it’s a food you like, buy 2x and store for later.

Feel free to buy 
- Iced tea 
- Cold brew coffee 
- Juices.
Notes: Store-bought iced tea, cold brew coffee, juices

Description: Make large batches when you can.
Make large batches when you can.
Make large batches when you can.

Effort Level: I can cook! And maybe prep
Description:
For a Smaller Batch of Granola - your Stovetop Works Just Fine. 
Don’t skimp on fat and sugar for flavor and crunch. 
Store well in an airtight container for a couple of weeks 
(Disclaimer: I haven’t tried it, I will update when I do). 
Toast nuts/seeds in dry pan, remove. 
Brown butter, add oats, stir often. 
Remove from heat, add fruit and nuts.
Notes: Oats/grains, Butter/Ghee/Oil, Honey/Maple/Sugar, Nuts, fruit, spices
